intro: Mammillaria radiosa f. chlorantha, commonly known as the green-flowered mammillaria, is a succulent cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems covered in white, woolly spines. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are often tinged with green, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. This variety is prized for its unique coloration and compact growth habit in succulent collections.
